tooltip.elementalcraft.planting: Plant back harvested crops or saplings
tooltip.elementalcraft.boneless_growth: Can grow crops that don't accept bonemeal
tooltip.elementalcraft.pickup: Will instantly pickup all items within range
tooltip.elementalcraft.nectar: Give nectar to bees instead of feeding humans
tooltip.elementalcraft.mystical_grove: Plant mystical flowers instead of traditional flowers
tooltip.elementalcraft.stem_pollination: Stem crops can now be grown to fruit
tooltip.elementalcraft.salmon: Allows you to breathe under water
tooltip.elementalcraft.demigod: Use totem of undying inside your inventory upon death
tooltip.elementalcraft.kirin: Deal a huge amount on damage on hit, doubled on undead
tooltip.elementalcraft.arctic_hares: Immune to freezing effects, allows you to walk on powdered snow
tooltip.elementalcraft.basilisk: Slow down the enemy you are looking at
tooltip.elementalcraft.strider.minecraft: Allows you to walk on lava
Allows you to walk on water
tooltip.elementalcraft.piglin: Count as if you were wearing gold armor for piglins
message.elementalcraft.missing_springali: You don't have a springaline shard in your inventory
message.elementalcraft.missing_analysis: You first need to analyze this source with a Source Analysis Glass
elementalcraft.landing: $(thing)ElementalCraft$() is a magic mod based around the 4 $(thing)elements$(): $(thing)fire$(), $(thing)water$(), $(thing)earth$() and $(thing)air$().$(br2)You can you can also find more information on the $(l:https://wiki.elementalcraft.org/)wiki$().
elementalcraft.category.source.desc: $(ec:source)Sources$() are naturally occurring spots where $(thing)elements$() converge.
elementalcraft.category.instruments.desc: $(thing)Instruments$() are the main crafting tools in $(thing)ElementalCraft$().$(br)They consume $(thing)elements$() and are required to be on top of a $(ec:container)Container$().
elementalcraft.category.crafting.desc: Here is everything you need to know about $(thing)Crafting$().
elementalcraft.category.shrines.desc: $(thing)Shrines$() are powerful tools that channel $(thing)elements$() in the world around them to act on it.
You can craft $(thing)shrine upgrades$() to increase the power of your $(thing)shrines$(). Those upgrades can only be placed at specific places around the $(thing)shrine$().$(br)Upgrades cover a wide range of bonuses from $(thing)speed$(), $(thing)reduce consumption$(), $(thing)range$()... or specific ones like $(thing)silk touch$() or $(thing)fortune$() for the $(l:shrines/oreshrine)ore shrine$().
elementalcraft.category.pipes.desc: The ability to move elements using pipes.
elementalcraft.category.spells.desc: Spells allow you to directly affect the world around you.$(br)You can always use a spell, but it will break if the required resource isn't present. To provide them you need to have an $(ec:holder)element holder$() of the same element.
elementalcraft.category.jewels.desc: $(thing)Jewels$() gives you passive bonuses at the cost of element from your $(ec:holder)element holder$().$(br)You can have this effect by either holding the jewel in one of your hand or by placing it on a piece of gear using an anvil.
elementalcraft.page.inert_crystal0: To get $(item)Inert Crystal$() start digging underground and mine $(item)Inert Crystal Ore$().
elementalcraft.page.contained_crystal0: $(item)Contained Crystals$() are the main components of $(thing)instruments$().$(br)By coating an $(item)Inert Crystal$() with $(thing)gold$() you are able to prevent it from being altered by $(thing)elements$() without losing its ability to interact with them.
elementalcraft.page.whiterock0: $(item)Whiterock$() is $(thing)earth infused$() $(item)stone$().$(br)It is used in the crafting of advanced $(thing)instruments$() and $(thing)shrines$().$(br)To get it simply put $(item)stone$() in an $(ec:infuser)infuser$()
elementalcraft.page.shards0: $(thing)Raw element shards$() are $(thing)elements$() that crystalized in contact with $(thing)creatures$().$(br)You can also get them by throwing and breaking $(item)elemental crystals$() by hand or with a $(item)dispenser$().$(br)They can be transformed into usable $(thing)element$() with an $(l:instruments/evaporator)evaporator$().
elementalcraft.page.springaline0: $(thing)Springaline$() is a very old material, legends say $(ec:source)sources$() spring from it.$(br)It can be recreated in a $(ec:binder)binder$() using ametysts, nether quartz and water crystals. Once you get your first shard its easier to create springaline clusters in your $(ec:binder)binder$() and mine them with a fortune pickaxe or $(l:instruments/air_mill_grindstone)air mill grindstone$().
elementalcraft.page.lenses0: $(item)Element lenses$() are pieces of glass that can channel some form of energy like sunlight into elements.$(br)They can be enchanted with unbreaking and/or infuse them with their corresponding $(thing)elements$() to increase their durability.
elementalcraft.page.gems0: $(item)Element gems$() are created with a $(l:instruments/crystallizer)gem crystallizer$(). There are three qualities of $(l:basics/gems)gems$(): crude, fine and pristine. You can always use a better quality gem than required by a recipe.
elementalcraft.page.pureinfuser0: The $(item)Pure Infuser$() is the most powerful crafting tool. It uses $(item)pedestals$() to channel all four $(thing)elements$() into a single item.$(br)To operate, it needs to be circled with each of the four $(item)pedestals$(), each being provided with the correct $(thing)element$() using $(ec:pipe)improved pipes$().$(br)Once this setup is done, you can start crafting by putting the correct $(item)ingredient$() on each $(thing)pedestal$() and the main one on the $(thing)pure infuser$().$(br2)Can be upgraded with up to three $(ec:rune)Runes$() and one for pedestals.
elementalcraft.page.source0: $(thing)Sources$() are naturally occurring spots where $(thing)elements$() converge.$(br2)It's strongly recommended to explore a bit and find at least one $(thing)sources$() for each $(thing)element$().$(br2)Be careful though as if you extract too much element from a source it will enter a recovery state. In this state you can no longer extract from the source until it fully recover its capacity.$(br)It is also recommended to mark their spots to find them easier again when you need them.
elementalcraft.page.source1: $(thing)Sources$() have natural affinity to different biomes or world area.$(br)$(thing)Fire$() is found in dry biomes and in the nether.$(br)$(thing)Water$() is found in wet biomes and over bodies of water.$(br)$(thing)Earth$() is fount in rock biomes and underground.$(br)$(thing)Air$() is found over tall biomes or plains, up in the sky and in the end.
elementalcraft.page.source_traits0: $(thing)Source traits$() are an ensemble of traits that define how $(ec:source)sources$() behave. This affect things like the amount they can hold or the speed it takes for them to recover. You can see source traits by using a $(l:sources/source_analysis_glass)source analysis glass$().
elementalcraft.page.source_traits1: $(thing)Capacity$(): The element capacity of the source, the bigger the capacity the longer it will take to exhaust and replenish the source.$(br)$(thing)Recovery$(): The speed at which the source recover elements once exhausted.$(br)$(e)Diurnal$(): Increase recovery speed during the day, decrease recovery speed during the night.$(br)$(1)Nocturnal$(): Increase recovery speed during the night, decrease recovery speed during the day.
elementalcraft.page.source_traits2: $(9)Generous$(): Increase the extraction speed from the source.$(br)$(c)Selfish$(): Decrease the extraction speed from the source.$(br)$(9)Thrifty$(): Decrease the element lost by the source during extraction.$(br)$(c)Wasteful$(): Increase the element lost by the source during extraction.$(br)$(9)Fertile$(): Reduce the element cost of $(l:sources/source_breeder)breeding$().$(br)$(c)Barren$(): Increase the element cost of $(l:sources/source_breeder)breeding$().
elementalcraft.page.source_traits3: $(c)Artificial$(): This $(ec:source)source$() was created through $(l:sources/source_breeder)breeding$() and therefore cannot recover any elements, it will disappear instead of recovering and are not recommended for element production.
elementalcraft.page.source_analysis_glas: The $(item)Source Analysis Glass$() can be used to analyse $(ec:source)sources$(). It will show you what $(ec:source_traits)traits$() the source has.$(br)Every analysis will consume a $(l:basics/springaline)Springaline shard$() from your inventory, so you need to have at least one in your inventory. You can either analyse a source by right-clicking it with the glass or from a receptacle by placing it in the upper right slot of the analysis GUI.
elementalcraft.page.source_displacement_: $(item)Source displacement plates$() are powerful tools that allow you to move $(ec:source)source$().$(br)You need to first analyse the source using a $(item)Source analysis glass$(). By placing them under sources, over a solid block and right clicking them, you can put them in a receptacle.$(br)Once the process is finished, the plate will be broken and will need a pristine gem to get repaired.
elementalcraft.page.source_stabilizer0: The $(item)source stabilizer$() is an item that can be used on $(ec:source)sources$(). It prevents them from being replaced by blocks. It also slightly increase the source recovery rate.
elementalcraft.page.source_breeder0: The $(item)source breeder$() is the strongest tool that can act on $(ec:source)sources$(). It has the ability to create new sources from existing ones. The created source will inherit $(ec:source_traits)traits$() from the parent sources.$(br)it needs a $(l:sources/source_seeds)source seed$() to create a new source.$(br2)Can be upgraded with up to three $(ec:rune)Runes$() and one for pedestals.
elementalcraft.page.source_seeds0: The $(item)source seeds$() are used in the $(l:sources/source_breeder)source breeder$() create new $(ec:source)sources$().$(br)If you use an artificial seed the source will have the artificial $(ec:source_traits)traits$(), you need a natural seed to create a source that behave like one found in the wild but they require to sacrifice a natural source to craft them.
elementalcraft.page.container0: The $(item)Element Container$() is a an $(thing)element$() storage, containing more $(thing)elements$() than the $(ec:small_container)Small Container$(), and it is compatible with all $(thing)instruments$().
elementalcraft.page.extractor0: Use an $(item)Extractor$() to extract $(thing)elements$() from $(ec:source)sources$().$(br2)To do so place the $(item)Extractor$() above a $(ec:container)Container$() and below the $(ec:source)source$() you want to extract.$(br2)Can be upgraded with one $(ec:rune)Rune$().
elementalcraft.page.evaporator0: The $(item)evaporator$() allows you to transform $(l:basics/shards)shards$() into $(thing)elements$(). It produces $(thing)elements$() extremely slowly.$(br2)To do so place the $(item)evaporator$() above a $(ec:container)Container$().$(br2)Can be upgraded with one $(ec:rune)Rune$().
elementalcraft.page.infuser0: Now that you can extract $(thing)elements$(), it's time to infuse them.$(br2)To do so you need an $(item)Infuser$() on top of a $(ec:container)Container$().$(br)Don't forget to connect it to the $(ec:extractor)Extractor$()'s $(ec:container)Container$() with a $(ec:pipe)pipe$().$(br2)By placing $(item)tools$() in an $(item)element infuser$() you can add effects to them. It's a good way to get early enchantments on tools. You can change the infusion on a tool at any time by infusing it with another element.$(br2)Can be upgraded with one $(ec:rune)Rune$().
elementalcraft.page.small_container0: The $(item)Small Element Container$() is a simple $(thing)element$() storage for providing $(thing)elements$() to $(thing)instruments$().$(br2)All $(thing)instruments$() need to be placed on top of a $(item)Container$() to operate.$(br)The $(item)Small Element Container$() can only work with $(ec:extractor)Extractors$() and $(ec:infuser)Infusers$().$(br)You can also transfer $(thing)elements$() from one $(item)Container$() to another using $(ec:pipe)pipes$().
elementalcraft.page.binder0: The $(item)Binder$() is one of the most important $(thing)Instrument$(). It channels $(thing)elements$() to combine multiples items together.$(br)Be careful because the order in which you put the items is important, you need to put them clockwise from the top.$(br)As for any other $(thing)Instruments$(), the $(item)Binder$() needs to be on top of a $(ec:container)Container$() but not a $(ec:small_container)Small Container$().$(br2)Can be upgraded with up to two $(ec:rune)Runes$().
elementalcraft.page.solar_synthesizer0: The $(item)solar element synthesizer$() allows you to harnest $(thing)elements$() from the sun light, it needs to see the sky and only woks during the day. You also need to provide $(l:basics/lenses)lens$() to make it work.$(br2)To do so place the $(item)solar element synthesizer$() above a $(ec:container)Container$().$(br2)Can be upgraded with up to two $(ec:rune)Runes$().
elementalcraft.page.mana_synthesizer0: The $(item)mana element synthesizer$() allows you to harnest $(thing)elements$() from botania mana. You also need to provide $(l:basics/lenses)lens$() to make it work.$(br2)To do so place the $(item)mana element synthesizer$() above a $(ec:container)Container$().$(br2)Can be upgraded with up to two $(ec:rune)Runes$().
elementalcraft.page.crystallizer0: The $(item)Gem crystallizer$() allows you to infuse the power of a single $(item)crystal$() to a $(item)diamond$() to create an $(l:basics/gems)elemental gem$(). $(br)To use it place the $(item)diamond$() first, then the $(thing)crystal$() and finally you can optionally add up to ten $(l:basics/shards)shards$() to increase the chance of a better quality $(l:basics/gems)gem$().$(br)It is also recommended to use a luck $(ec:rune)rune$() on it to increase the chance.$(br2)Can be upgraded with up to three $(ec:rune)Runes$() including luck ones.
elementalcraft.page.inscriber0: The $(item)Rune Inscriber$() is used to create $(ec:rune)Runes$().$(br)At the difference of other $(thing)instruments$() it needs to be right-clicked multiple times whit a $(item)Rune Inscription Chisel$() to operate.$(br2)Can be upgraded with up to three $(ec:rune)Runes$().
elementalcraft.page.firefurnace0: The $(item)Fire Furnace$() smelts items by using $(thing)fire element$() instead of fuel.$(br)As for any other $(thing)Instruments$(), the $(item)Fire Furnace$() needs to be on top of a $(ec:container)Container$(). It consumes $(thing)fire$().$(br2)Can be upgraded with up to two $(ec:rune)Runes$().
elementalcraft.page.fireblastfurnace0: The $(item)Fire Blast Furnace$() is the $(item)Blast Furnace$() variant of the $(ec:firefurnace)Fire Furnace$().$(br)As for any other $(thing)Instruments$(), the $(item)Fire Blast Furnace$() needs to be on top of a $(ec:container)Container$() but not a $(ec:small_container)Small Container$(). It consumes $(thing)fire$().$(br2)Can be upgraded with up to three $(ec:rune)Runes$().
elementalcraft.page.extractor_improved0: The $(item)Improved Extractor$() is an advanced version of the $(ec:extractor)Extractor$(). It extract $(thing)elements$() faster.$(br)As for any other $(thing)Instruments$(), the $(item)Improved Extractor$() needs to be on top of a $(ec:container)Container$() but not a $(ec:small_container)Small Container$().$(br2)Can be upgraded with up to three $(ec:rune)Runes$().
elementalcraft.page.purifier0: The $(item)Purifier$() takes $(item)ores$() and purify them to create $(item)Pure ores$() at a ratio of one to two. You can then smelt them into $(item)ingots$() in any $(item)Furnaces$().$(br)As for any other $(thing)Instruments$(), the $(item)purifier$() needs to be on top of a $(ec:container)Container$() but not a $(ec:small_container)Small Container$().$(br)It consumes $(thing)earth$().$(br2)Can be upgraded with up to three $(ec:rune)Runes$() including luck ones.
elementalcraft.page.air_mill_grindstone0: The $(item)Air mill grindstone$() allows you to grind down items like $(item)stone$() to $(item)gravel$().$(br)As for any other $(thing)Instruments$(), the $(item)air mill grindstone$() needs to be on top of a $(ec:container)Container$() but not a $(ec:small_container)Small Container$().$(br)It consumes $(thing)air$().$(br2)Can be upgraded with up to three $(ec:rune)Runes$() including luck ones.
elementalcraft.page.water_mill_wood_saw0: The $(item)Water mill wood saw$() allows you to cut down items mainly $(item)wood$() to to more refinded varient.$(br)As for any other $(thing)Instruments$(), the $(item)water mill wood saw$() needs to be on top of a $(ec:container)Container$() but not a $(ec:small_container)Small Container$().$(br)It consumes $(thing)water().$(br2)Can be upgraded with up to three $(ec:rune)Runes$() including luck ones.
elementalcraft.page.binder_improved0: The $(item)Improved Element Binder$() works like a $(ec:binder)Binder$() and $(ec:infuser)Infuser$() meaning it can do either binding or infusion at a faster rate.$(br)As for any other $(thing)Instruments$(), the $(item)improved binder$() needs to be on top of a $(ec:container)Container$() but not a $(ec:small_container)Small Container$().$(br2)Can be upgraded with up to three $(ec:rune)Runes$().
elementalcraft.page.reservoir0: The $(item)Element Reservoirs$() is a an advanced $(thing)element$() storage, containing more $(thing)elements$() than the $(ec:container)Container$(), it is compatible with all $(thing)instruments$(). But there is four different version each one fore each elements.
elementalcraft.page.diffuser0: The $(item)Element diffuser$() fills the $(ec:holder)element holders$() of nearby players, the $(item)improved diffuser$() needs to be on top of a $(ec:container)Container$() but not a $(ec:small_container)Small Container$().$(br2)Can be upgraded with up to three $(ec:rune)Runes$().
elementalcraft.page.elementpipe0: $(item)Pipes$() are used to transport $(thing)elements$() across distances.  Their main use is to provide $(thing)instruments$() with the required $(thing)element$().$(br2)You can configure a $(item)pipe$() by right-clicking a section or the core to change it from $(thing)connected$(), $(thing)disconnected$(), $(thing)insert$() or $(thing)extract$().$(br2)$(item)Pipes$() exist in three tiers: impaired, normal and improved.
elementalcraft.page.cover_frame0: The $(item)pipe cover frame$() allows you to hide a $(ec:pipe)pipe$() behind a block. Use it on a pipe (preferably while sleeking) then right click it with the block you want to hide it behind.$(br)you can hide frames and show pipes by holding a pipe, a frame or having an empty hand.
elementalcraft.page.pipe_priority_rings0: $(item)Pipe priority rings$() is an upgrade you can put on a $(ec:pipe)pipe$() section to encourage $(thing)elements$() flow in a specific direction.
elementalcraft.page.element_valve0: The $(item)Element valve$() is an upgrade you can put on a $(ec:pipe)pipe$() section to only let $(thing)elements$() flow whet it receive a redstone signal.
elementalcraft.page.element_beam0: The $(item)Element beam$() is an upgrade you can put on two $(ec:pipe)pipe$() sections facing each other allows element transfer between them for a short range.
elementalcraft.page.element_pump0: The $(item)Element pump$() is an upgrade you can put on a $(ec:pipe)pipe$() extracting section to greatly improve it's extracting speed at the cost of wasting a portion of transferred elements.$(br2)Can be upgraded with up to three speed only $(ec:rune)Runes$().
elementalcraft.page.element_holder0: $(item)Element Holders$() can hold $(thing)elements$(), for transport or for use by $(thing)spells$().$(br)To fill them hold right-click on a $(ec:source)source$() of the same $(thing)element$() type. You can also transfer $(thing)element$() back to a receiver by holding right-click on it.
elementalcraft.page.purerock0: $(item)Pure Rock$() is an extremely strong stone that is able to resist some of the most powerful blasts, even a $(thing)Wither$().
elementalcraft.page.instrument_retriever: The $(item)Instrument Output Retriever$() is a finely-tweaked machine that can interact with $(thing)instruments$() and handle their output for themself, allowing you to extract their output upon crafting and store it in a $(item)chest$(), for example.$(br2)You can reorient its input and output by right-clicking them.
elementalcraft.page.sorter0: The $(item)Ordered Sorter$() use the advanced properties of swift alloy to insert specific items in a specific order into any $(thing)instrument$() or $(thing)chest$().$(br)You can add a new item to the order list by right-clicking the middle part.$(br)You can reorient its input and output by right-clicking them.$(br2)Can be upgraded with up to three speed only $(ec:rune)Runes$().
elementalcraft.page.rune0: $(thing)Runes$() are infused with element power that can be transferred to $(thing)instruments$() to boost their properties.$(br)They are created using an $(l:instruments/inscriber)inscriber$() and a chisel.$(br)You can simply add them by right clicking the instrument with the rune, and remove them either with a chisel or by breaking the instrument.
elementalcraft.page.pure_element_holder0: $(item)Pure element holders$() is an improved version of the $(ec:holder)element holder$().It can store all four $(thing)elements$() at once and in a way bigger quantity.
elementalcraft.page.using_shrines0: Shrines require element to be $(ec:pipe)piped$() in to operate. If the source don't find the action to perform it wont consume any element.$(br2)You can display the range of any shrine for 30secs by shift right clicking on it with an empty hand.
elementalcraft.page.using_shrines1: You can see if the shrine is currently running by looking at the check at the bottom right of the element gauge:
elementalcraft.page.using_shrines3: The shrine is running but did not find anything to do
elementalcraft.page.using_shrines4: The shrine is out of element
elementalcraft.page.firepylon0: The $(item)Fire Pylon$() is a $(thing)Shrine$() that sets fire to nearby $(thing)creatures$().$(br2)It consumes $(thing)fire element$().
elementalcraft.page.oreshrine0: The $(item)Ore Shrine$() excavates $(thing)ores$() underneath it leaving only $(item)stone$() where the $(thing)ore$() was.$(br2)It consumes $(thing)earth element$().
elementalcraft.page.lavashrine0: The $(item)Lava Shrine$() melts $(item)basalt$() above it into $(item)lava$().$(br2)It consumes $(thing)fire element$().
elementalcraft.page.sweetshrine0: The $(item)Sweet Shrine$() periodically refills hunger. It can also boost nearby $(thing)bees$() production instead if you upgrade it with a $(l:shrine_upgrades/shrine_upgrade_nectar)Nectar shrine upgrade$().$(br2)It consumes $(thing)water element$().
elementalcraft.page.vacuumshrine0: The $(item)Vacuum Shrine$() pulls towards itself nearby $(item)items$() and stores them in the container below it.$(br2)It consumes $(thing)air element$().
elementalcraft.page.growthshrine0: The $(item)Growth Shrine$() accelerates $(thing)crops$() growth from its level up to 3 block above it. To grow $(thing)crops$() that cannot grow with $(item)bonemeal$() you need to upgrade the $(item)growth shrine$() with a $(l:shrine_upgrades/shrine_upgrade_boneless_growth)boneless growth shrine$().$(br2)It consumes $(thing)water element$().
elementalcraft.page.harvestshrine0: The $(item)Harvest Shrine$() harvest $(thing)crops$() below it.$(br2)It consumes $(thing)earth element$().
elementalcraft.page.lumbershrine0: The $(item)Lumber Shrine$() cut down $(thing)trees() and $(thing)leaves() above and around it.$(br2)It consumes $(thing)earth element$().
elementalcraft.page.overloadshrine0: The $(item)Overload Shrine$() boost the speed of the $(item)block$() it's facing, it cannot boost other shrines.$(br2)It consumes $(thing)air element$().
elementalcraft.page.enderlockshrine0: The $(item)Ender Lock Shrine$() channels $(thing)water$() through the ender matrix preventing anything passing through it.$(br)Near it $(thing)endermen$() can't teleport, $(item)ender pearls$(), $(item)chorus fruits$() $(l:spells/ender_strike)Ender strike$(), $(l:spells/translocation)translocation$() and other teleportation don't work.$(br2)It consumes $(thing)water element$().
elementalcraft.page.breedingshrine0: The $(item)Breeding Shrine$() uses $(thing)food$() laying around to breed $(thing)animals$() in range.$(br2)It consumes $(thing)earth element$().
elementalcraft.page.groveshrine0: The $(item)Wild Grove Shrine$() will create wild $(thing)flowers$() on top of $(item)grass$().$(br2)It consumes $(thing)water element$().
elementalcraft.page.springshrine0: The $(item)Spring Shrine$() will create a water block on top of it.$(br2)It consumes $(thing)water element$().
elementalcraft.page.buddingshrine0: The $(item)Budding Shrine$() grows $(item)amethyst clusters$() on top of it.$(br2)It consumes $(thing)earth element$().
elementalcraft.page.spawningshrine0: The $(item)Spawning Shrine$() summon mobs around it.$(br2)It consumes $(thing)fire element$().
elementalcraft.page.shrine_upgrade_accel: The $(item)Acceleration Shrine Upgrade$() double the speed of a shrine. It can be placed on any side including top and bottom.
elementalcraft.page.shrine_upgrade_range: The $(item)Range shrine upgrade$() increase the range of a shrine at the cost of speed and increased element consumption. It can be placed on any side including top and bottom.
elementalcraft.page.shrine_upgrade_capac: The $(item)Capacity shrine upgrade$() greatly increase the capacity of a shrine at the cost of speed and increased element consumption. It can be placed on any side including top and bottom.
elementalcraft.page.shrine_upgrade_effic: The $(item)efficiency shrine upgrade$() halves the element consumption of a shrine at the cost of a bit of capacity. It can be placed on any side including top and bottom.
elementalcraft.page.shrine_upgrade_optim: The $(item)optimization shrine upgrade$() reduce the element consumption and increase the speed and capacity of a shrine but it can only use two. It can be placed on any side including top and bottom.
elementalcraft.page.shrine_upgrade_stren: The $(item)strength shrine upgrade$() double the strength of the effect of a shrine at the cost of increasing consumption. It can be placed on any side including top and bottom.$(br)It cannot be use in combination with a $(l:shrine_upgrades/shrine_upgrade_nectar)nectar shrine upgrade$() or a $(l:shrine_upgrades/shrine_upgrade_pickup)pickup shrine upgrade$().
elementalcraft.page.shrine_upgrade_fortu: The $(item)Fortune shrine upgrade$() gives one level of fortune to a shrine up to three at the cost of increased element consumption. It can be placed on all four side but not on top and bottom. It cannot be use in combination with a $(l:shrine_upgrades/shrine_upgrade_silk_touch)silk touch shrine upgrade$().
elementalcraft.page.shrine_upgrade_silk_: The $(item)Silk touch shrine upgrade$() gives the silk touch effect to a shrine at the cost of increased element consumption. It can be placed on all four side but not on top and bottom. It cannot be use in combination with a $(l:shrine_upgrades/shrine_upgrade_fortune)fortune shrine upgrade$().
elementalcraft.page.shrine_upgrade_plant: The $(item)Planting shrine upgrade$() plant back harvested crops or saplings. It can only be placed on the bottom of an $(l:shrines/harvestshrine)harvest shrine$().
elementalcraft.page.shrine_upgrade_bonel: The $(item)Boneless growth shrine upgrade$() give the ability to a $(l:shrines/growthshrine)growth shrine$() to grow crops that cannot grow with bone meal. It can only be placed on top of a $(l:shrines/growthshrine)growth shrine$(). It cannot be use in combination with a $(l:shrine_upgrades/shrine_upgrade_stem_pollination)stem pollination shrine upgrade$().
elementalcraft.page.shrine_upgrade_picku: The $(item)Pickup Shrine Upgrade$() is a shrine upgrade exclusive to the $(l:shrines/vacuumshrine)vacuum shrine$(). It completely changes the behavior of the $(l:shrines/vacuumshrine)vacuum shrine$(), it will instantly pick up items instead of pulling them towards it first. It can only be placed on top of the shrine. It cannot be use in combination with a $(l:shrine_upgrades/shrine_upgrade_vortex)vortex shrine upgrade$() or a $(l:shrine_upgrades/shrine_upgrade_strength)strength shrine upgrade$().
elementalcraft.page.shrine_upgrade_vorte: The $(item)vortex shrine upgrade$() is a shrine upgrade exclusive to the $(l:shrines/vacuumshrine)vacuum shrine$(). It change the shrine to pull mobs and creatures instead of items. It can only be placed on top of the shrine. It cannot be use in combination with a $(l:shrine_upgrades/shrine_upgrade_pickup)pickup shrine upgrade$().
elementalcraft.page.shrine_upgrade_necta: The $(item)nectar shrine upgrade$() is a shrine upgrade that change a $(l:shrines/sweetshrine)sweet shrine$() to provide bees with nectar instead of feeding player. It can be placed on all four side but not on top and bottom. It cannot be use in combination with a $(l:shrine_upgrades/shrine_upgrade_strength)strength shrine upgrade$().
elementalcraft.page.shrine_upgrade_stem_: The $(item)stem pollination shrine$() upgrade give the ability to a $(l:shrines/growthshrine)growth shrine$() to mature melons or pumpkins. It can only be placed on top of a growth shrine. It cannot be use in combination with a $(l:shrine_upgrades/shrine_upgrade_boneless_growth)boneless growth shrine upgrade$().
elementalcraft.page.shrine_upgrade_prote: The $(item)protection shrine upgrade$() alter a shrine that affect creatures to only affect hostile mobs. It can be placed on any side but not on top and bottom.
elementalcraft.page.shrine_upgrade_filli: The $(item)filling shrine upgrade$() is a shrine upgrade exclusive to the $(l:shrines/springshrine)spring shrine$(). It completely changes the behavior of the $(l:shrines/springshrine)spring shrine$(), it will instantly fill the liquid tank with water above the filling shrine upgrade. It can only be placed on top of the shrine.
elementalcraft.page.shrine_upgrade_sprin: The $(item)Springaline shrine upgrade$() is a shrine upgrade exclusive to the $(l:shrines/buddingshrine)budding shrine$(). That make the budding shrine grow $(l:basics/springaline)springaline cluster$() instead of amethyst. It can be placed on any of the four sides but not on top nor bottom.
elementalcraft.page.shrine_upgrade_cryst: The $(item)crystal harvest shrine upgrade$() is a shrine upgrade for the $(l:shrines/buddingshrine)budding shrine$() and the $(l:shrines/oreshrine)ore shrine$(). That make the $(l:shrines/buddingshrine)budding shrine$() automatically harvest the amethyst or $(l:basics/springaline)springaline cluster$() once fully grown. And the $(l:shrines/oreshrine)ore shrine$() harvest fully grown crystals from budding blocks. It can be placed on any of the four sides but not on top nor bottom.
elementalcraft.page.shrine_upgrade_mysti: The $(item)mystical grove shrine upgrade$() is a shrine upgrade exclusive to the $(l:shrines/wildgroveshrine)wild grove shrine$(), it is only available if botania is present in the pack. That make the $(l:shrines/wildgroveshrine)wild grove shrine$() grow botania mystical flowers instead of traditional flowers. It can be placed on top.
elementalcraft.page.shrine_upgrade_cryst: The $(item)crystal growth shrine upgrade$() makes the $(l:shrines/growthshrine)growth shrine$() speedup the growth of budding crystals like amethyst instead of crops, this does not affect crystals that a $(l:shrines/buddingshrine)budding shrine$() is growing. It can only be placed on top of a $(l:shrines/growthshrine)growth shrine$(). It cannot be use in combination with a $(l:shrine_upgrades/shrine_upgrade_boneless_growth)boneless growth shrine upgrade$()
elementalcraft.page.shrine_upgrade_trans: The $(item)translocation shrine upgrade$() makes the $(l:shrines/growthshrine)growth shrine$() moves the target location of the shrine operate at to a $(l:spells/translocation_anchor)translocation anchor$().$(br)To specify the new location first right click the anchor with the $(item)translocation shrine upgrade$() to bind it to the anchor, then place it normally on the shrine.
elementalcraft.page.shrine_upgrade_overc: The $(item)overclocked acceleration shrine upgrade$() is a more powerful version of the $(l:shrine_upgrades/shrine_upgrade_acceleration)acceleration shrine upgrade$(). You can also connect $(ec:pipe)pipes$() on it's back to supply the shrine with elements. It can be placed on all four side but not on top and bottom.
elementalcraft.page.spell_desk0: To craft $(thing)spells$() you need a $(item)spell desk$().$(br)To use it right-click to open the crafting interface.$(br)You then have to place a $(item)scroll paper$(), an $(item)element crystal$() of the $(thing)element$() of the spell you want and a $(l:basics/gems)gem$() of the quality you need or better.$(br)Please refers to JEI for recipes details.
elementalcraft.page.casting_spells0: Spells can be cast either from the $(thing)scroll$(), $(l:spells/focus)focus$() or a $(l:spells/staff)staff$(). The consumes $(thing)element$() from the $(ec:holder)element holder$() in your inventory, Some spells do have additional costs, please refers to the spell page to know them.
elementalcraft.page.casting_spells1: You can see if you can cast a spell by looking at the check at the bottom right of the element gauge:
elementalcraft.page.focus0: A $(item)focus$() can hold multiple $(thing)spells$().$(br)You can add $(thing)spells$() to it by putting the $(item)focus$() in an $(item)anvil$() with the $(item)scroll$() of the $(thing)spell$(). You can circle through $(thing)spells$() by holding shift and scrolling.
elementalcraft.page.staff0: You can get a $(item)staff$() from a $(item)diamond/netherite sword$() and a  $(l:spells/focus)focus$(), it will preserve the enchantment of the sword and the spells of the focus.
elementalcraft.page.spell_book0: The $(item)Elementalist Grimoire$() allows you to store $(thing)spells$().You can right-click it to open its inventory.
elementalcraft.page.fireball0: Throw a $(thing)fire ball$() in the direction you are looking.$(br)Consumes $(thing)fire$() from an $(ec:holder)element holder$().
elementalcraft.page.gravelfall0: Summon a column of $(item)gravel$() above the targeted $(thing)block$() or $(thing)entity$().$(br)Consumes $(thing)earth$() from an $(ec:holder)element holder$() and three $(item)gravel$().
elementalcraft.page.stonewall0: Summon a three by three $(thing)stone wall$() in front of you to protect you from attacks.$(br)Consumes $(thing)earth$() from an $(ec:holder)element holder$() and nine $(item)stone$().
elementalcraft.page.heal0: Heal you or the targeted $(thing)entity$().$(br)Consumes $(thing)water$() from an $(ec:holder)element holder$().
elementalcraft.page.ender_strike0: Teleport behind targeted $(thing)entity$() or closest $(thing)monster$() and strike it with increased damage. Be careful not to use it near an $(l:shrines/enderlockshrine)Ender lock shrine$().$(br)Consumes $(thing)air$() from an $(ec:holder)element holder$().
elementalcraft.page.item_pull0: Pull all nearby $(item)items to you.$(br)Consumes $(thing)air$() from an $(ec:holder)element holder$().
elementalcraft.page.animal_growth0: Fully grow targeted $(thing)animal child$().$(br)Consumes $(thing)water$() from an $(ec:holder)element holder$().
elementalcraft.page.tree_fall0: Cut down targeted $(thing)tree$().$(br)Consumes $(thing)earth$() from an $(ec:holder)element holder$().
elementalcraft.page.purification0: Remove all negative $(thing)effects$() on you or the targeted $(thing)entity$().$(br)Consumes $(thing)water$() from an $(ec:holder)element holder$().
elementalcraft.page.ripening0: Fully grows targeted $(thing)crops$().$(br)Consumes $(thing)water$() from an $(ec:holder)element holder$().
elementalcraft.page.flame_cleave0: Hit all $(thing)entities$() around you with a burning circular attack.$(br)Consumes $(thing)fire$() from an $(ec:holder)element holder$().
elementalcraft.page.inferno0: Breathe fire in front of you dealing damage to all the $(thing)entities$() in a cone.$(br)This spell is channeled, you must hold right click to cast it.$(br)Consumes $(thing)fire$() from an $(ec:holder)element holder$().
elementalcraft.page.dash0: Dash in targeted direction.$(br)Consumes $(thing)air$() from an $(ec:holder)element holder$().
elementalcraft.page.silk_vein0: Mine a whole $(thing)ore vein$() with silk touch.$(br)Consumes $(thing)earth$() from an $(ec:holder)element holder$().
elementalcraft.page.speed0: Increase speed and attack speed for you or the targeted $(thing)entity$().$(br)Consumes $(thing)air$() from an $(ec:holder)element holder$().
elementalcraft.page.translocation0: Teleport you 100 block in the targeted direction, if you target a $(l:spells/translocation_anchor)translocation anchor$() it will teleport you to it instead.$(br)Consumes $(thing)air$() from an $(ec:holder)element holder$().
elementalcraft.page.translocation_anchor: A plate that allows you to teleport to it with a $(l:spells/translocation)translocation spell$().$(br)It can also be used to move a shrine operation to it with a $(l:shrine_upgrades/shrine_upgrade_translocation)translocation shrine upgrade$()
elementalcraft.page.feather_spikes0: Throw three feather projectiles in front of you in a quick succession.$(br)Consumes $(thing)air$() from an $(ec:holder)element holder$().
elementalcraft.page.air_shield0: Channel air in front of you to block projectiles and hits (like a shield does). $(br)This spell is channeled, you must hold right click to cast it.$(br)Consumes $(thing)air$() from an $(ec:holder)element holder$().
elementalcraft.page.shockwave0: Knock back and damage mobs around you.$(br)Consumes $(thing)air$() from an $(ec:holder)element holder$().
elementalcraft.page.repair0: Repair the item in your other hand, you need to target a block so the anvil can spawn on top of it.$(br)This spell is channeled, you must hold right click to cast it$(br)Consumes $(thing)fire$() from an $(ec:holder)element holder$().
elementalcraft.page.salmon0: The $(item)jewel of the salmon$() allows you to breathe under water.$(br)Consumes $(thing)water$() from an $(ec:holder)element holder$().
elementalcraft.page.phoenix0: The $(item)jewel of the phoenix$() makes you invulnerable to fire and makes it heal you.$(br)Consumes $(thing)fire$() from an $(ec:holder)element holder$().
elementalcraft.page.tortoise0: The $(item)jewel of the tortoise$() makes you immune to damages from falling blocks.$(br)Consumes $(thing)earth$() from an $(ec:holder)element holder$().
elementalcraft.page.demigod0: The $(item)jewel of the demigod$() allows you to use totems of undying inside your inventory upon death without holding them in hand.$(br)Consumes $(thing)air$() from an $(ec:holder)element holder$().
elementalcraft.page.mole0: The $(item)jewel of the mole$() increase your mining speed, it only triggers if you are digging.$(br)Consumes $(thing)earth$() from an $(ec:holder)element holder$().
elementalcraft.page.viper0: The $(item)jewel of the viper$() adds poison to your attacks.$(br)Consumes $(thing)water$() from an $(ec:holder)element holder$().
elementalcraft.page.hawk0: The $(item)jewel of the hawk$() makes your projectiles follow the target you are aiming at.$(br)Consumes $(thing)air$() from an $(ec:holder)element holder$().
elementalcraft.page.kirin0: The $(item)jewel of the kirin$() makes your hits strike the target with a second smiting hit that do a good amount of damage (double on undead) and set the target on fire.$(br)Consumes $(thing)fire$() from an $(ec:holder)element holder$().
elementalcraft.page.arctic_hares0: The $(item)jewel of the arctic hares$() allows you to walk powdered snow and makes you immune to freezing effects.$(br)Consumes $(thing)water$() from an $(ec:holder)element holder$().
elementalcraft.page.basilisk0: The $(item)jewel of the basilisk$() allows you to slow down the enemy you are looking at.$(br)Consumes $(thing)water$() from an $(ec:holder)element holder$().
elementalcraft.page.strider0: The $(item)jewel of the strider$() allows you to walk on lava.$(br)Consumes $(thing)fire$() from an $(ec:holder)element holder$().
elementalcraft.page.water_strider0: The $(item)jewel of the water strider$() allows you to walk on water.$(br)Consumes $(thing)water$() from an $(ec:holder)element holder$().
elementalcraft.page.bear0: The $(item)jewel of the bear$() increase the strength of your hits.$(br)Consumes $(thing)earth$() from an $(ec:holder)element holder$().
elementalcraft.page.tiger0: The $(item)jewel of the tiger$() increase your attack speed while fighting.$(br)Consumes $(thing)air$() from an $(ec:holder)element holder$().
elementalcraft.page.leopard0: The $(item)jewel of the leopard$() increase your sprinting speed.$(br)Consumes $(thing)air$() from an $(ec:holder)element holder$().
elementalcraft.page.dolphin0: The $(item)jewel of the dolphin$() increase your swimming speed.$(br)Consumes $(thing)water$() from an $(ec:holder)element holder$().
elementalcraft.page.piglin0: The $(item)jewel of the Piglin$() pacify piglins around you.$(br)Consumes $(thing)water$() from an $(ec:holder)element holder$().
